name: Kokkos
description: Kokkos C++ Performance Portability Programming Ecosystem: The Programming Model - Parallel Execution and Memory Abstraction
contribution_requirements_justification: Requirements for acceptable contributions are covered by https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos/blob/develop/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos/blob/develop/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The project is licensed under the Apache-2.0 license WITH LLVM-exception. The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).  Kokkos is packaged for Fedora which means the license meets their requirement.
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license WITH LLVM-exception is approved by OSI, see https://opensource.org/license/apache-2-0 and https://spdx.org/licenses/LLVM-exception.html.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: All code development happens on GitHub using pull requests
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/kokkos/kokkos/blob/develop/CHANGELOG.md>.
build_floss_tools_justification: The primary build system is CMake.
test_justification: We are using CTest with Github Workflows.
test_invocation_justification: We are using CTest with Github Workflows.
warnings_strict_justification: We treat warnings as error in our CI builds.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: The project uses CodeQL and the Clang Static Analyzer as part of the CI.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We are using CTest with Github Workflows and jenkins.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff". Required security hardening headers missing: https://kokkos.org: content-security-policy, strict-transport-security, x-content-type-options, x-frame-options
dco_justification: We use a DCO and enforce it on all contributions via GitHub action.
governance_justification: Our governance model is detailed in https://github.com/kokkos/governance in the GOVERNANCE.md file.
roles_responsibilities_justification: Key roles in the project are documented in https://github.com/kokkos/governance in the GOVERNANCE.md file under the "Project Leads" section.
access_continuity_justification:
Kokkos is a Linux Foundation project.  LF co-owns the organization on GH and holds our assets including the domain name for our website.
https://insights.linuxfoundation.org/project/kokkos-project/repository/kokkos-kokkos
bus_factor_justification:
The project has a bus factor of 3.
https://insights.linuxfoundation.org/project/kokkos-project/repository/kokkos-kokkos/contributors
sites_password_security_justification: We do not store password, we connect to GitHub identity using OAuth.
maintenance_or_update_justification:
We maintain last minor release and provide patches as necessary.
We support the last minor release of the previous major release series for a year.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: There have been no vulnerabilities reported in the last 12 months.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: We enforce proper formatting (clang-format and cmake-format amongst other things) in our pre-commit testing.
build_preserve_debug_justification: Debugging information are preserved when requested at configuration time.
installation_standard_variables_justific: Our build system honor standard conventions for selecting the location where built artifacts are written to at installation time.
installation_development_quick_justifica: Potential developers can download the project source code, configure and build using CMake.
input_validation_justification: Kokkos is a programming model.  The only inputs it takes are command-line arguments and environment variables to control the runtime.  When provided, all variables are validated and bad formats cause immediate abnormal program termination.
version_tags_signed_justification: Release tags are signed by the maintainers, so are the cryptographic hashes for the release archives.
project_entry_attribution: Please credit Daniel Arndt and the CII Best Practices badge contributors.
